title: Transient impact from the Nash equilibrium of a permanent market impact game. (arXiv:2205.00494v2 [q-fin.TR] UPDATED)
abstract: A large body of empirical literature has shown that market impact of financial prices is transient. However, from a theoretical standpoint, the origin of this temporary nature is still unclear. We show that an implied transient impact arises from the Nash equilibrium between a directional trader and one arbitrageur in a market impact game with fixed and permanent impact. The implied impact is the one that can be empirically inferred from the directional trader's trading profile and price reaction to order flow. Specifically, we propose two approaches to derive the functional form of the decay kernel of the Transient Impact Model, one of the most popular empirical models for transient impact, from the behaviour of the directional trader at the Nash equilibrium. The first is based on the relationship between past order flow and future price change, while in the second we solve an inverse optimal execution problem. translated_title: 一篇关于永久市场影响博弈纳什均衡的瞬态影响研究
translated_abstract: 大量实证文献表明，金融价格的市场影响是短暂的，但从理论上讲，这种临时性的原因仍不清楚。本文研究了一个固定和永久影响的市场影响博弈中的方向交易者和套利交易者之间的纳什均衡，发现隐含的瞬态影响来自于方向交易者的交易策略和价格对订单流的反应。本文提出了两种方法来推导瞬态影响模型的衰减核函数的函数形式，第一种方法基于过去的订单流和未来的价格变化之间的关系，而第二种方法则解决了一种逆最优执行问题。
tldr: 本文研究了市场影响博弈中的纳什均衡，从中发现了隐含的瞬态影响，揭示了瞬态影响模型的衰减核函数的函数形式。
en_tdlr: This paper studies the Nash equilibrium between a directional trader and an arbitrageur in a market impact game with fixed and permanent impact, and reveals the implied transient impact from it, which leads to the functional form of the decay kernel of the Transient Impact Model.
